intro: Alchornea guatemalensis, commonly known as Guatemalan beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, clustered purple berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. The berries are an important food source for various bird species and are also used in traditional medicine.
